props.text: To minimize the impact and risk of occupational accidents, hazard identification was conducted at each operating location. No major hazards were identified in 2023.

paragraphs: Our company places employee health and safety as a top priority, striving to create a comfortable, safe, and accident-free working environment. Following the Occupational Safety and Health Act and relevant industry regulations, the policy is managed by the General Affairs Unit, covering areas such as:

items.label: Regular inspections of the office environment, with recommendations for improvements when necessary.
Promote the importance of environmental safety through emails and encourage employees to provide feedback.

paragraphs: Currently, our occupational safety and health management system covers 178 employees, including all employees except consultants and overseas staff.
Our work environment consists mainly of office and storage locations, with the following occupational safety and health standards established for each:

items.label: Install drinking water facilities that meet standards, with regular cleaning and maintenance.
Install a complete fire safety system according to regulations (e.g., emergency power outlets, smoke exhaust systems, exit signs, fire extinguishers, escape routes).
Fire equipment inspection: once per year; fire drills: once every six months.
The building management committee assigns security personnel responsible for building patrol, visitor registration, and vehicle access control to ensure building safety.
Our company has two employees certified in fire safety to provide guidance in case of emergencies.
Adhere to the principle of safety first in storage areas, with cargo handling and stacking following the Ministry of Labor's Occupational Safety and Health Facility Regulations.
The stacking height of goods should not exceed 180 cm or six layers, whichever is reached first.
Use mechanical equipment, such as carts, to reduce manual handling when transporting goods.
Promote the use of closed-toe shoes in the workplace for better protection.

paragraphs: Regular occupational safety training and awareness courses are held for new employees to enhance their knowledge of occupational safety and awareness of workplace safety, thereby reducing the likelihood of safety incidents. In 2023, two employees were assigned to a 12-hour 'Fire Safety Manager' training course to obtain fire safety certification, responsible for developing and implementing the companyâ€™s fire protection plan. In September of the same year, all employees attended an occupational safety and health course, with a total attendance of 152 people, amounting to 456 hours.
